metadata.title: 2022 San Francisco Fire Code - Key Sections for Permit Routing
metadata.base_code: 2022 California Fire Code (Title 24, Part 9) based on 2021 International Fire Code
metadata.notes: SF Fire Code incorporates CA Fire Code by reference with local amendments. Sections marked [For SF] are SF-specific. The prefix indicates SF replaces the corresponding state/IFC section.

decision_tree_key.description: When SFFD (Fire Department) review is triggered for a building permit application

triggers.description: All new building construction requires SFFD plan review
triggers.details: Central Permit Bureau collects plan review fees for SFFD review based on project valuation

triggers.description: Any new, modified, or extended fire sprinkler system, fire alarm system, or gaseous suppression system
triggers.details: Construction permits required through DBI; SFFD plan review and field inspection required. Inspection fees: fire alarm $272 (2hr), sprinkler $408 (3hr), gaseous suppression $272 (2hr)

triggers.description: Any work in buildings with occupied floors >75 feet above lowest fire dept vehicle access
triggers.details: High-rise buildings trigger extensive SFFD requirements: fire safety director, air replenishment (>120ft), dual risers, FDC on each street-facing side, smoke control analysis, fire command center

triggers.description: Any Group A occupancy (restaurants >49 occupants, bars, theaters, churches, arenas)
triggers.details: Place of Assembly operational permit required ($387). Outdoor assembly >500 enclosed or >1000 open requires permit. Group A occupancies on piers need sprinklers (914.12)

triggers.description: Any change in occupancy classification, operation, tenancy, or ownership
triggers.details: Permits are not transferable. New permit required for any change in occupancy, operation, tenancy, or ownership

triggers.description: Any project impacting street width or fire apparatus access roads
triggers.details: SFFD reviews all projects impacting street width. Min 20ft unobstructed width, 13ft 6in vertical clearance required

triggers.description: New residential buildings on subdivided lots
triggers.details: 5ft clear access pathway from public right-of-way required. Rear buildings behind existing full-width buildings need sprinklered access corridor

triggers.description: New or modified Emergency Responder Communication Coverage System (ERRCS)
triggers.details: Operational permit required. Must be NRTL-certificated per AB 2.01 Addendum G and AB 3.04

triggers.description: Any building requiring smoke control systems
triggers.details: Rational analysis required with construction documents submission covering active/passive zones, tenability

triggers.description: Commercial cooking equipment requiring Type I hood with automatic fire suppression
triggers.details: Automatic fire-extinguishing systems required for commercial cooking operations. Must be serviced every 6 months. Qualified personnel per 903.5.1 required

triggers.description: Storage, use, or handling of hazardous materials above threshold quantities
triggers.details: Operational permits required for compressed gas, cryogenics, explosives, flammable liquids, HPM facilities

triggers.description: Storage/charging facility for 5+ e-bikes, scooters, or powered mobility devices
triggers.details: 5+ devices charging indoors requires 1-hour fire barrier, sprinkler system (903.3.1.1), fire alarm (907), smoke detectors

triggers.description: Any fuel oil storage system or fuel-oil generator
triggers.details: Must comply with NFPA 30, NFPA 37, and AB 2.07 regardless of fuel quantity

always_requires_sffd_review: New or modified fire alarm system
New or modified gaseous/hood suppression system
conditionally_requires_sffd_review: Alterations with construction value triggering plan review fees (Table 107-B)
Projects impacting fire apparatus access roads or street width
Lot subdivision with new residential construction

permits_required.rule: Operational permits from SFFD for activities under 105.5. Construction permits (building permits) from DBI for systems/equipment under 105.6.
permits_required.important: Any person installing or modifying fire protection systems must obtain a building permit from DBI before starting work

construction_permit_fees.plan_review_basis: Based on valuation of work as determined by DBI

high_rise_inspection_fee.fee_basis: $13.93 per 1,000 sq ft gross floor area

schools_registration.rule: All schools must register with SFFD Bureau of Fire Prevention prior to occupancy

historic_buildings.rule: Fire code provisions not mandatory for classified historic buildings unless they constitute a distinct hazard to life or property

permit_not_transferable.rule: Permits not transferable. New permit required for any change in occupancy, operation, tenancy, or ownership

key_operational_permits.type: Outdoor Assembly Event (>500 enclosed or >1000 open)

open_flames.portable_open_flame_devices: Must be enclosed/installed to prevent flame contact with combustibles (308.1.6.2)

barbed_wire.rule: Prohibited on fire escapes, standpipes, parapets, roofs where it could hinder firefighters

construction_type_signage.rule: Buildings with composite wood joist or truss construction must post signage per AB 5.05

5_plus_devices_charging_indoors.requirement: 1-hour fire barrier enclosure, automatic sprinkler system (903.3.1.1), fire alarm (907), smoke detectors, 4-A:20-B:C fire extinguisher

lithium_ion_batteries_powered_mobility.safety_certification_required: UL 2849, UL 2272, EN 15194, EN 17128 or SFFD-approved equivalent

fire_apparatus_access.sffd_review: SFFD reviews all projects impacting street width; may require greater minimums case-by-case
fire_apparatus_access.no_obstructions: No parking or obstruction of fire apparatus access roads (503.4)

divided_lot_structures.rule: New residential buildings on subdivided lots require 5ft clear pathway from public right-of-way
divided_lot_structures.rear_buildings: Need 5ft x 80in access corridor with sprinkler protection (903.3) from public ROW

roof_access.rule: Doors to roofs must be openable from inside without key/code. Locked doors allowed only with supervised unlocking, power-failure auto-unlock, 2-way communication, and palm button

water_supply.flow_information: SFFD provides on request ($136 fee; $272 if on-site test needed)
water_supply.validity: 1 year from date water flow info returned to applicant

fire_command_center.water_protection: Watertight construction to prevent water intrusion from sprinkler discharge (508.1.9)

emergency_radio_coverage.standard: NFPA 1225-2022 Chapter 18 and AB 2.01 Addendum G

air_replenishment_system.trigger: Buildings with occupied floors >120ft above lowest FD vehicle access (permit applications after March 30, 2004)
air_replenishment_system.exception: Buildings with fire service access elevator (FSAE) per CBC 3007
air_replenishment_system.purpose: Provides means for firefighters to refill SCBA air bottles

elevators.rule: At least one passenger elevator must be maintained in working order and accessible for immediate Fire Department use at all times

inside_buildings.standards: NFPA 30 and NFPA 37 apply to all fuel-oil systems and generators regardless of quantity
inside_buildings.local_standard: AB 2.07 applies to all fuel-oil systems regardless of quantity

sprinkler_triggers_from_california_fire_.note: SF incorporates CA Fire Code Section 903.2 by reference. The following are the key triggers from the California Fire Code that SF enforces, plus SF local amendments.

group_A_assembly.when_required: Automatic sprinkler system required in Group A occupancies. Fire area >12,000 sqft, or occupant load >300, or fire area on floor other than level of exit discharge

group_A_1.description: Assembly with fixed seating for viewing performing arts or movies
group_A_1.threshold: Fire area >12,000 sqft OR occupant load >300 OR not on level of exit discharge

group_A_2.description: Assembly for food/drink consumption (restaurants, bars, banquet halls)
group_A_2.threshold: Fire area >5,000 sqft OR occupant load >100 OR not on level of exit discharge

group_B_business.when_required: Fire area >12,000 sqft, or building >3 stories, or combined fire areas >24,000 sqft

group_E_education.when_required: Fire area >12,000 sqft, or building >1 story (with exceptions)

group_F_factory.F1_moderate_hazard: Fire area >12,000 sqft, or building >3 stories, or combined >24,000 sqft

group_M_mercantile.when_required: Fire area >12,000 sqft, or building >3 stories, or combined >24,000 sqft

group_R_residential.when_required: Automatic sprinkler system required throughout buildings with Group R fire area. R-1 (hotels), R-2 (apartments/condos), R-4 (residential care)

group_R_sf_amendment.exception: Additions/alterations to existing 1-2 family dwellings and townhouses (3 stories max) without existing sprinklers do NOT require sprinkler retrofit

group_S_storage.S1_moderate_hazard: Fire area >12,000 sqft, or building >3 stories, or combined >24,000 sqft

existing_sro_hotels.trigger: Existing residential hotels with 20+ guest rooms (existing Oct 16, 2001)
existing_sro_hotels.requirement: Automatic sprinkler throughout residential occupancy including accessory areas

trigger_conditions: Occupied floor >120ft above lowest FD access
Occupied floor >75ft but <=120ft AND lacks two 2-hour rated exit stairways
Occupied floor >75ft but <=120ft AND lacks smoke detection in mechanical rooms, corridors, elevator lobbies, and at stairway enclosure doors
exceptions: Mixed-use with R-2: exempt until January 1, 2033
permissible_omissions_for_retrofit: Water supply from two underground lines
Connection to two risers per floor

piers_group_a_and_f.trigger: Group A and F occupancies on piers of combustible construction

divided_lot_rear_buildings.trigger: New residential buildings behind existing full-width building on subdivided lot
divided_lot_rear_buildings.requirement: Access corridor with sprinkler protection per 903.3

installation_requirements.personnel: C-16 fire protection contractor license required (903.3.10)
installation_requirements.fitter_cert: CA-OSFM Fire Sprinkler Fitter Certificate required for employees
installation_requirements.4_inch_service: Two or more FDC inlet connections required (912.8)
installation_requirements.high_rise_risers: Each zone connects to at least two risers per floor (914.3.1.1)
installation_requirements.high_rise_fdc: FDC on each side of building fronting a street, four inlets each (914.3.1.3)

commercial_kitchen_hoods.requirement: Automatic fire-extinguishing systems required for commercial cooking. Must be serviced every 6 months and after activation.
commercial_kitchen_hoods.inspection_record: Certificate of inspection maintained on-site for 1 year

standpipe_systems.stages: Stages >1,000 sqft require Class III wet standpipe with 1.5in and 3in connections each side (905.3.4)
standpipe_systems.limited_access_buildings: Standpipes required in any building where fire code official determines necessary regardless of height (905.3.12)
standpipe_systems.roof_outlet: At least one 2-way outlet above roofline for slopes <4:12 (905.4.3)

triggers: Building contains more than 6 dwelling or sleeping units
Congregate living facilities 3+ stories OR occupant load of 11+

automatic_smoke_detection_r2.exception_1: No interior corridors AND each sleeping unit has direct exit access
automatic_smoke_detection_r2.exception_2: Building fully sprinklered (903.3.1.1 or 903.3.1.2) with waterflow notification and manual pull station

congregate_r3.trigger: Group R-3 congregate living with occupant load 6+

annunciation.trigger: Buildings with more than 4 floors or when required by fire code official
annunciation.type: LED display showing device type by floor/zone

high_rise_zoning_panel.requirements: Status of emergency generator, fire pump, secondary water supply per AB 3.01

certification_required.rule: All new fire alarm systems must be NRTL-certificated
exceptions: Control units whose primary function is sprinkler monitoring

building_permit_alarm_upgrade.trigger: Building permit with construction cost >= $99,000 OR July 1, 2023 (whichever first)
building_permit_alarm_upgrade.requirement: Upgrade fire alarm to meet NFPA 72 sleeping area sound levels (18.4.5.1)

high_rise_alarm_reporting.requirement: Reports must state operational matrix: Full Evacuation, Partial Evacuation, or Relocation system per AB 3.05

analysis_required.requirement: Rational analysis with construction documents covering system types, operations, supporting systems, construction methods

active_passive_zones.rule: Passive zones enclosed by smoke barriers/partitions unless technically justified. Fire code official may require tenability analysis

pump_room_integrity.rule: No non-fire-pump equipment allowed in fire pump room (no domestic water, drains, HVAC, boilers, electrical switchgear)

high_rise_drives.rule: Each pump drive (power, motors, fuel, controllers) must be independent

fire_water_storage.integrity: No non-fire water piping, electrical, or drains in fire water tank (914.3.2.1)
fire_water_storage.overflow_routing: Must route to remote drain, not in fire pump room (914.3.2.2)
fire_water_storage.sump_pumps: Permitted only when gravity not available; must be redundant, remote, emergency-powered (914.3.2.2.1)

door_swing.exception_6: In non-Group A, E, H, I, R, and non-high-rise buildings: special purpose horizontal sliding, accordion, or folding doors allowed per 1010.3.3

special_sliding_doors.restriction: NOT allowed in Group A, E, H, I, R, or high-rise occupancies

exit_signs.fire_escape_sign: Doorways to fire escapes require 'FIRE ESCAPE' sign in 6-inch letters, high contrast

emergency_escape_rescue.lot_line_buildings: Emergency escape may pass through building via exit passageway (per 1024) with AHJ approval

fire_escape_maintenance.rule: Fire escapes must not be obstructed. No storage on fire escapes without fire code official approval. Cannot be behind locked doors

structural_examination.frequency: Every 5 years by registered design professional
structural_examination.report: Maintained on-site, available for SFFD review

existing_sprinkler_requirements.note: See chapter_9 sprinkler section for details on 1103.5.1 (SRO), 1103.5.2 (hotels), 1103.5.4 (high-rise)

existing_fire_alarm_sleeping_area_upgrad.trigger: Building permit with cost of construction >= $99,000
existing_fire_alarm_sleeping_area_upgrad.requirement: Upgrade fire alarm system to comply with NFPA 72 sleeping area sound levels
existing_fire_alarm_sleeping_area_upgrad.exception: Mandatory seismic strengthening and transient R-1 hotels

existing_fire_alarm_certification.rule: Fire code official may require owners to obtain certificate per AB 3.03

fire_escape_structural_adequacy.rule: Non-combustible construction required. Must support dead + live load per original design or professional determination

appendix_m_high_rise_retroactive_sprinkl.status: DELETED - International Fire Code Appendix M is deleted by SF
appendix_m_high_rise_retroactive_sprinkl.replacement: SF addresses high-rise retroactive sprinkler requirements through Section 1103.5.4 of the Fire Code and Administrative Bulletin AB-105

ab_105_voluntary_sprinkler.purpose: Procedure for documenting voluntary sprinkler protection in pre-1974 high-rise buildings exempt from Ord. 377-93
ab_105_voluntary_sprinkler.scope: High-rise buildings built before July 1, 1974, excluded from the high-rise sprinkler retrofit ordinance
key_steps: Sprinkler design per NFPA 13 edition at time of permit application
Sprinkler special inspection by CA-licensed fire protection engineer

assembly_occupancy_thresholds.description: Key occupant load and area thresholds that trigger SFFD requirements for assembly uses

group_A_2_food_drink.note: Group A-2 has lower thresholds than other A occupancies

fire_alarm_manual_pull.trigger: More than 6 dwelling/sleeping units in R-2
fire_alarm_manual_pull.congregate: 3+ stories OR occupant load 11+ in congregate living

hood_suppression_commercial_kitchens.description: Requirements for commercial cooking hood and suppression systems

automatic_suppression.requirement: Automatic fire-extinguishing systems required for commercial cooking equipment producing grease-laden vapors (Type I hoods)
automatic_suppression.servicing: Every 6 months and after each activation
automatic_suppression.permit_routing: Construction permit through DBI with SFFD plan review required for new or modified systems

referenced_standards.nfpa_96: Standard for Ventilation Control and Fire Protection of Commercial Cooking Operations
referenced_standards.ul_300: Standard for Fire Testing of Fire Extinguishing Systems for Protection of Commercial Cooking Equipment

high_rise_requirements_summary.definition: Building with occupied floor >75ft above lowest level of fire department vehicle access

75_to_120_ft.sprinkler_retrofit_existing: Required if lacking 2hr exit stairways OR smoke detection in key areas (1103.5.4)

voluntary_sprinkler_pre_1974.process: Pre-application meeting, NFPA 13 design, special inspection, Administrative Permit

administrative_bulletins_referenced.subject: Emergency procedures information and evacuation signs
High-rise fire alarm zoning annunciator panel
Air replenishment system testing and maintenance
Voluntary sprinkler protection for existing high-rise buildings (DBI)
